Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, like a playground, garden, forest, or parking lot, showing the different living things that can be found there.
The student can draw a water habitat, like a pond, stream, or lake, showing the different living things that can be found there.
The student can include different types of plants, such as trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants, in each habitat drawing.
The student can include different types of animals, such as lizards, squirrels, ants in the land habitat, and fish, clams in the water habitat.
The student can compare and label the variety of living things in each habitat to show the differences and similarities.
The student can observe patterns in the plant and animal diversity across the two habitats through their drawings.
